gaia::core::Widget Class Reference

The Widget class is the base class of all user interface component. More...

Private Member Functions

 DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN (Widget)

Detailed Description

The Widget class is the base class of all user interface component.

Using Widget

Drawing

Drawing is performed by traversal the widget tree.
To foce a widget to draw, call refresh().

Definition at line 136 of file Widget.h.

anonymous enum
Enumerator:
OVER_SCROLL_ALWAYS 

Always allow a user to over-scroll this widget, provided it is a widget that can scroll.

See also:
getOverScrollMode()
setOverScrollMode(int32_t)
OVER_SCROLL_IF_CONTENT_SCROLLS 

Allow a user to over-scroll this widget only if the content is large enough to meaningfully scroll, provided it is a widget that can scroll.

See also:
getOverScrollMode()
setOverScrollMode(int32_t)
OVER_SCROLL_NEVER 

Never allow a user to over-scroll this widget.

See also:
getOverScrollMode()
setOverScrollMode(int32_t)

Member Function Documentation

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::bringToFront ( ) [virtual]

Change the widget item's z order in the tree, so it's on top of other sibling widget items.

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::buildDrawingCache ( bool  autoScale) [virtual]

Forces the drawing cache to be built.

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::cancelLongPress ( ) [virtual]

Cancels a pending long press.

Your subclass can use this if you want the context menu to come up if the user presses and holds at the same place, but you don't want it to come up if they press and then move around enough to cause scrolling.

Reimplemented in gaia::ui::TextWidget.

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::clearAnimation ( ) [virtual]

Cancels any animations for this widget item.

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::clearFocus ( ) [virtual]

Called when this widget wants to give up focus.

This will cause onFocusChanged to be called.

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::computeScroll ( ) [virtual]

Called by a parent to request that a child update its values for mScrollX and mScrollY if necessary.

This will typically be done if the child is animating a scroll.

Reimplemented in gaia::ui::CellPager, and gaia::ui::TextWidget.

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::destroyDrawingCache ( ) [virtual]

Frees the resources used by the drawing cache.

If you call buildDrawingCache() manually without calling setDrawingCacheEnabled(true), you should cleanup the cache with this method afterwards.

gaia::core::Widget::DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN ( Widget  ) [private]

Returns:
return focus widget if exists.

Reimplemented in gaia::core::WidgetController.

virtual Widget* gaia::core::Widget::findWidgetById ( int32_t  id) [virtual]

Look for a child widget item with the given id.

If this widget item has the given id, return this widget item.

virtual Widget* gaia::core::Widget::focusSearch ( int32_t  direction) [virtual]

This does not actually give focus to that widget item.

Find the nearest widget item in the specified direction that can take focus.

virtual int32_t gaia::core::Widget::getHorizontalFadingEdgeLength ( ) [virtual]

Returns the size of the horizontal faded edges used to indicate that more content in this widget is visible.

Returns:
The size in pixels of the horizontal faded edge or 0 if horizontal faded edges are not enabled for this widget.
virtual int32_t gaia::core::Widget::getId ( ) [virtual]

Sets the identifier for this widget item.

The identifier does not have to be unique in this widget item's hierarchy. The identifier should be a positive number.

virtual IFocusChangeListener* gaia::core::Widget::getIFocusChangeListener ( ) [virtual]

Return the focus-change callback registered for this widget.

virtual int32_t gaia::core::Widget::getLayerType ( ) [virtual]

Indicates what type of layer is currently associated with this widget.

By default a widget does not have a layer, and the layer type is LAYER_TYPE_NONE. Refer to the documentation of setLayerType(int32_t, const gaia::graphics::Paint*) for more information on the different types of layers.

Returns:
LAYER_TYPE_NONE, LAYER_TYPE_SOFTWARE or LAYER_TYPE_HARDWARE
See also:
setLayerType(int32_t , const gaia::graphics::Paint*)
LAYER_TYPE_NONE
LAYER_TYPE_SOFTWARE
LAYER_TYPE_HARDWARE

Reimplemented in gaia::core::TextureWidget.

Parameters:
rthe result of this function will be stored in it.
virtual void gaia::core::Widget::getLocationOnScreen ( int32_t  location[]) [virtual]

Computes the coordinates of this widget on the screen.

The argument must be an array of two integers. After the method returns, the array contains the x and y location in that order.

Parameters:
locationan array of two integers in which to hold the coordinates

int32_t gaia::core::Widget::getOverScrollMode ( )

Returns the over-scroll mode for this widget.

The result will be one of OVER_SCROLL_ALWAYS (default), OVER_SCROLL_IF_CONTENT_SCROLLS (allow over-scrolling only if the widget content is larger than the container), or OVER_SCROLL_NEVER.

Returns:
This widget's over-scroll mode.

virtual float gaia::core::Widget::getScaleX ( ) [virtual]

The amount that the widget is scaled in x around the pivot point, as a proportion of the widget's unscaled width.

A value of 1, the default, means that no scaling is applied.

By default, this is 1.0f.

Returns:
The scaling factor.

Return the scene which this widget included.

Return the scrolled left position of this widget.

int32_t gaia::core::Widget::getScrollY ( )

Return the scrolled top position of this widget.

virtual int32_t gaia::core::Widget::getSuggestedMinimumHeight ( ) [virtual]

Returns the suggested minimum height that the widget should use.

This returns the maximum of the widget's minimum height and the background's minimum height.

When being used in onMeasure(int32_t, int32_t), the caller should still ensure the returned height is within the requirements of the parent.

Returns:
The suggested minimum height of the widget.
virtual int32_t gaia::core::Widget::getSuggestedMinimumWidth ( ) [virtual]

Returns the suggested minimum width that the widget should use.

This returns the maximum of the widget's minimum width and the background's minimum width.

When being used in onMeasure(int32_t, int32_t), the caller should still ensure the returned width is within the requirements of the parent.

Returns:
The suggested minimum width of the widget.

virtual bool gaia::core::Widget::hasFocusable ( ) [virtual]

Returns true if this widget is focusable or if it contains a reachable widget for which hasFocusable() returns true.

A "reachable hasFocusable()" is a widget whose parents do not block descendants focus.

Only VISIBLE widgets are considered focusable.

Returns:
True if the widget is focusable or if the widget contains a focusable widget, false otherwise.

void gaia::core::Widget::layout ( int32_t  l,
int32_t  t,
int32_t  r,
int32_t  b 
)

Assign a size and position to a widget and all of its descendants.

This is the second phase of the layout mechanism. (The first is measuring). In this phase, each parent calls layout on all of its children to position them. This is typically done using the child measurements that were stored in the measure pass().

Derived classes with children should override onLayout. In that method, they should call layout on each of their their children.

Parameters:
lLeft position, relative to parent
tTop position, relative to parent
rRight position, relative to parent
bBottom position, relative to parent
void gaia::core::Widget::measure ( int32_t  widthMeasureSpec,
int32_t  heightMeasureSpec 
)

This is called to find out how big a widget should be.

The parent supplies constraint information in the width and height parameters. The actual mesurement work of a widget is performed in onMeasure(int32_t, int32_t), called by this method. Therefore, only onMeasure(int32_t, int32_t) can and must be overriden by subclasses.

Parameters:
widthMeasureSpecHorizontal space requirements as imposed by the parent
heightMeasureSpecVertical space requirements as imposed by the parent
See also:
onMeasure(int32_t, int32_t)

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::onConfigurationChanged ( const gaia::content::Configuration *  newConfig) [virtual]

Called when the current configuration of the resources being used by the application have changed.

You can use this to decide when to reload resources that can changed based on orientation and other configuration characterstics. You only need to use this if you are not relying on the normal mechanism of recreating the page instance upon a configuration change.

Parameters:
newConfigThe new resource configuration.

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::setLayerType ( int32_t  layerType,
const gaia::graphics::Paint *  paint 
) [virtual]

Specifies the type of layer backing this widget. The layer can be disabled, software or hardware.

A layer is associated with an optional Paint instance that controls how the layer is composed on screen. The following properties of the paint are taken into account when composing the layer:

  • {graphics.Paint::getAlpha() Translucency (alpha)}
  • {graphics.Paint::getXfermode() Blending mode}
  • {graphics.Paint::getColorFilter() Color filter}

If this widget has an alpha value set to < 1.0 by calling setAlpha(float), the alpha value of the layer's paint is replaced by this widget's alpha value. Calling setAlpha(float) is therefore equivalent to setting a hardware layer on this widget and providing a paint with the desired alpha value.

Refer to the documentation of disabled, software and hardware for more information on when and how to use layers.

Parameters:
layerTypeThe ype of layer to use with this widget, must be one of LAYER_TYPE_NONE, LAYER_TYPE_SOFTWARE or LAYER_TYPE_HARDWARE
paintThe paint used to compose the layer. This argument is optional and can be null. It is ignored when the layer type is LAYER_TYPE_NONE
See also:
getLayerType()
LAYER_TYPE_NONE
LAYER_TYPE_SOFTWARE
LAYER_TYPE_HARDWARE
setAlpha(float)
virtual void gaia::core::Widget::setLongClickable ( bool  longClickable) [virtual]

Enables or disables long click events for this widget item1.

When a widget item is long clickable it reacts to the user holding down the button for a longer duration than a tap. This event can either launch the listener or a context menu.

void gaia::core::Widget::setOverScrollMode ( int32_t  overScrollMode)

Set the over-scroll mode for this widget.

Valid over-scroll modes are OVER_SCROLL_ALWAYS (default), OVER_SCROLL_IF_CONTENT_SCROLLS (allow over-scrolling only if the widget content is larger than the container), or OVER_SCROLL_NEVER.

Setting the over-scroll mode of a widget will have an effect only if the widget is capable of scrolling.

Parameters:
overScrollModeThe new over-scroll mode for this widget.

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::setPivotX ( float  pivotX) [virtual]

Sets the x location of the point around which the widget is rotated.

By default, the pivot point is centered on the object. Setting this property disables this behavior and causes the widget to use only the explicitly set pivotX and pivotY values.

Parameters:
pivotXThe x location of the pivot point.
virtual void gaia::core::Widget::setPivotY ( float  pivotY) [virtual]

pivotYThe y location of the pivot point.

Sets the degrees that the widget is rotated around the pivot point.

Increasing values result in clockwise rotation.

Parameters:

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::setRotationX ( float  rotationX) [virtual]

Sets the degrees that the widget is rotated around the horizontal axis through the pivot point.

Increasing values result in clockwise rotation from the viewpoint of looking down the x axis.

When rotating large widgets, it is recommended to adjust the camera distance accordingly.

Parameters:
rotationXThe degrees of X rotation.
virtual void gaia::core::Widget::setRotationY ( float  rotationY) [virtual]

Sets the degrees that the widget is rotated around the vertical axis through the pivot point.

Increasing values result in counter-clockwise rotation from the viewpoint of looking down the y axis.

When rotating large widgets, it is recommended to adjust the camera distance accordingly.

Parameters:
rotationYThe degrees of Y rotation.

virtual void gaia::core::Widget::setWillNotCacheDrawing ( bool  willNotCacheDrawing) [virtual]

When a widget's drawing cache is enabled, drawing is redirected to an offscreen bitmap.

Some widget, like an ImageWidget, must be able to bypass this mechanism if they already draw a single bitmap, to avoid unnecessary usage of the memory.

Parameters:
willNotCacheDrawingtrue if this widget does not cache its drawing, false otherwise
virtual void gaia::core::Widget::setWillNotDraw ( bool  willNotDraw) [virtual]

If this widget doesn't do any drawing on its own, set this flag to allow further optimizations.

By default, this flag is not set on widget, but could be set on some widget subclasses such as WidgetController.

Typically, if you override onDraw you should clear this flag.

Parameters:
willNotDrawwhether or not this widget draw on its own
virtual void gaia::core::Widget::setX ( float  x) [virtual]

Sets the visual x position of this widget, in pixels.

This is equivalent to setting the translationX property to be the difference between the x value passed in and the current left property.

Parameters:
xThe visual x position of this widget, in pixels.
